original_title: Sunday, Monday And Tuesday I Was Out Of Film In Chicago
overview: This film is a travelogue in Chicago, which is also a study on color and black and white, the expired and the fresh film, and the fast and the slow pace. I was looking at the city in the snow through the Costa Rican artist Federico Herreroâ€™s installation, Alphabet, on the window at the Museum of Contemporary Art Chicago, and wondering what the difference would be between shooting this grey scenery with color film and with black and white film. As Herrero creates a landscape with color blocks, what landscape would I create with my two rolls of film? - Erica Sheu
title: Sunday, Monday And Tuesday I Was Out Of Film In Chicago
